attributes.action: Change the law on dangerous  dogs attacks
attributes.additional_details: After  being  attacked  on my own front  doorstep  with my 2dogs  by 2 dangerously  out of control  dogs  not muzzled or on leads which resulted  in one of my dogs dying   I want there to be tougher sentences  for the owners of these dogs on a public road  this  attack has had a massive  impact on myself  and my family  also my other dog which survived  especially  as the owners made no attempt  to help  me and just laughed  it of and ran away  I hope I can stop this from happening  to anyone
attributes.background: I want them to change  the dangerous  dog law  act section  1 in 1997 the law was amended relating rules the act only covers  dog attacks  to a human not injury or death to other animals and does not cover mental  injury  to  a human  witnessing  a attack  PTSD for example

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about dog attacks, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Section 1 of the Dangerous Dogs Act relates to dogs bred for fighting, and it's not clear what if any changes you want to this section of this Act.

Section 3 of the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991 makes it an offence for an owner to let their dog get dangerously out of control, and we have published the following petitions calling for changes to these rules, which you might like to sign:

Increase penalties for the owners of dangerously out of control dogs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581140

Extend Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953 protections to all Wildlife: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574020

If you wan the Government to do something different to the above petitions you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
